labels.analysis: The MCP Server "DocsFetcher" is designed to fetch and present documentation for npm packages, libraries, and URLs, making it particularly useful for large language models (LLMs) that require access to up-to-date developer documentation. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving human-readable documentation, which can be fed into LLMs for natural language understanding or code analysis. The available tools focus entirely on fetching documentation, with variations for packages, libraries, and multilingual content.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server fetches documentation from the web, serving as a research tool for LLMs. The secondary labels "Developer Tools" and "Web Automation" are relevant as the server preprocesses documentation, which can be used for code-related tasks and involves automated web interactions.

url.description: URL of the library documentation to fetch

packageName.description: Name of the package to fetch documentation for

language.description: Programming language or repository type (e.g., javascript, python, java, dotnet)

library.description: Name of the package or URL of the library documentation to fetch

language.description: Programming language or repository type if providing a package name (e.g., javascript, python, java, dotnet)

languages.description: List of programming languages or repository types to check (e.g., javascript, python, java)

server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch npm package documentation and present it for LLMs.

url.description: URL of the library documentation to fetch

packageName.description: Name of the package to fetch documentation for

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@cdugo/mcp-get-docs/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
